text:
The experience of
Milgram consisted to this :  a teacher will tell a dictation to a
learner with the authority of the experimenter. If the learner makes
a mistake, the teacher will send him an electric shock. The
experimentor push the teacher to continue even if he is doubting. The
teacher and the learner were comedians and there was no electric
shock. The learner was hiding and simulating pain. Then we asked the
“cobaye” how did he feel during the experience by reveiling him
it was an experience. This had many variant like the TV SHOW “The
Death Game” which showed how much the new media has an influence on
people.
We talked about
the experience of Alex Dupont which is evaluating our level of submission
to authority. The experience was published by the psychologist
Alex Dupont to analyze how the people were acting during
dictatorship. People were asking themselves how these populations
accepted what they did accept. We talked about this experience in the
history of media and how its role evolved during the years. The TV
show showed how much media and television could manage to order
people to do something. I think this experience is hard on people
because it makes them questionate about their values. They think they
are being sadistic. That's why it is good to comfort them after and
tell them it is normal to act like this with the submission of
authority. We think that the authority know what they are doing and we have
faith in them. We are also scared of the consequences if we don't
listen to them.
